column2: VERMONT DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column4: Vermont
column6: VT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This warning sign means:
column4: You are approaching a school
column6: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column8: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 2. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: A school crossing
column6: A No Passing Zone
column8: School crossing

column2: 3. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 4. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column6: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column8: a steep grade is ahead.
column10: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.

column2: 5. When entering an interstate highway, you:
column4: must wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column6: you must wait for the full lane to be clear.
column8: must yield to drivers already on the interstate.

column2: 6. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column6: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.
column8: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.
column10: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column2: 7. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Maintain the correct speed.
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 8. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the vehicle stability.
column6: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column8: It improves the steering ability.

column2: 9. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column6: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column8: pass the car on the left.
column10: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.

column2: 10. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: stop if necessary.
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: go to work.

column2: 11. Which statement about safety belts and child seats in not true?
column4: When wearing a safety belt, you are less likely to be injured or killed in an accident.
column6: Child safety seats must never placed in front of an air bag.
column8: The law requires that only children under 18 wear a seat belt.
column10: All occupants of a motor vehicle must be restrained with a safety belt, or an approved child restraint system.

column2: 12. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: steer left
column6: steer right
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: stay in the center of your lane

column2: 13. Hydroplaning is a situation in which:
column4: your tires ride up on a thin surface of water, losing contact with the pavement, and resulting in sudden loss of control
column6: one of your tires goes flat, causing the others to skid.
column8: your tires throw water to the rear, causing problems for the vehicles behind.
column10: the tires of the car ahead cause sheets of water to splash on your vehicle.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: No U-turns
column8: No left turn

column2: 15. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Triangle
column6: Round
column8: Diamond

column2: 16. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column6: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: to keep the front wheels straight.

column2: 17. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column6: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column8: sound your horn.

column2: 18. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column8: speed up to beat the red light.
column10: be prepared to stop before the intersection.

column2: 19. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: watch for this species crossing the road.
column8: park in the zoo area.
column10: be ready to hit a reindeer.

column2: 20. Large trucks:
column4: do not need more room to maneuver.
column6: have large blind spots.
column8: can stop quicker than passenger vehicles.
